column5: That's great, one of the most clever inventions I have seen.  I hope you patent and start selling it...oh wait...maybe that's not such a good idea....those poor remote lake fish  Tony

..fish are just a bonus in the grand scheme of things!!  Thanks for the week of laughs Lloyd, you know I truely needed it.  Hopefully I'll find time in the next few weeks to get some summer adventures posted.... especially our "football" adventure.
Nothing better than good friends with an open ear Wayne
Nice post Wayne.  Too true!!   You sure that fire is big enough to cook them weenies  Glad you're back.  Joey
Was wondering when you'd pop up again   Howdy!
YEAP
Love the weekends "fishing with the guys" reports.  Lots of good times. Good to see you back too Wayne.
Great report and pics Wayne Definitely what fishing with friends is all about  Looks like your little piece of paradise!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman

First picture is a stocked speck lake we had good results in during the winter... nadda from shore though after walking the portage into it. The second picture of a spot we flew into and fished from the canoe.... the lake shall remain forever nameless! (but we'll be back.. over and over and over again! )
I think I know that lake in the 1st pic! Surprised that fire is still going! Nice to have you back Wanye... any idea how to repair some aluminum?LMAO! HH
Dunna what the big deal is. Doesn't everyone have a floatplane kickin' around for impromptu flyins?  JF
Issue with many of these "back" lakes in the Temagami area John is no matter what the huggers say... there are roads EVERYWHERE!
yeah that's Lloyd always fishing or eating  sounds like you 2 had fun...... at lest no slush to get stuck in ,on that back lake
Yeah, but why share a fireroad with the bears & the skunks?  Seems to me a floatplane is the epitome of fishing chic.  JF
Nice!!! The little back lakes have the potential to be walleye factories that's for sure!!
Sounds like a nice relaxing time there Wayne. Glad you guys were able to get out and away from some stressful periods.
Wayne I think we should show some of the football game we played, And yes we will be going back as long as you can fly and I can see them under the plane lol
Here's me as quarter back... lol
That last  pic looks like you use a float plane for a TROLLING MOTOR
wow that is a football

We were actually packing up and getting ready to put the canoe back on the airplane when Lloyd said "grab a rod and drop the bait in between the floats". 2 monsters hiding in the shade of the airplane.
Carole has been keeping me updated Wayne...you needed a week just like that!!! Glad to hear you had a great time and it was just what you needed...been a tough summer for you and Leah...
Agreed, fished with some friends a few times this year. Too bad that those trips are the trip that end the soonest.
Talking to Lloyd, he said teh pair of ya had a great time. Good on ya's.
Looks like a good time surrounded by some OK scenery hehe  Have you made any further modifications to the boat holster? getting better at deploying and stowing?
Working like a charm as is Tony. It's 5 times easier to load and unload on the water than it was in the hangar on jack stands.
